text: Consider the following Peshwas and arrange them in ascending chronological order:
Raghunath Rao (Raghoba)
Balaji Baji Rao
Narayan Rao

Balaji Vishwanath

Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) $4,2,3,1$
(b) $3,4,1,2$
(c) $1,2,3,4$
(d) $1,3,2,4$
Consider the following statements with reference to early trade:
There are references of numerous river-ports in ancient India.

There were large entrepots of goods and traffic.

Which of the above statements is/are correct?
(a) Both 1 and 2
(b) Neither 1 nor 2
(c) Only 1
(d) Only 2
Arrange the following Sen rulers of Bengal in ascending chronological order:
Ballal Sen
Lakshman Sen
Hemant Sen

Vijaya Sen

Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) $4,3,2,1$
(b) $2,1,4,3$
(c) $1,2,3,4$
(d) $3,4,1,2$
Consider the following statements with reference to Bairam Khan:
Akbar gave the title of Khan-i-Khana to Bairam Khan.

This title was not given at the time of appointment of Bairam Khan as Vazir of Empire.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
(a) Both 1 and 2
(b) Neither 1 nor 2
(c) Only 1
(d) Only 2

सूची-I को सूची II से सुमेलित कीजिए और सूचियों के नीचे दिए गए कूट का प्रयोग कर सही उत्तर चुनिए:

सूची-I
A. मानव विकास रिपोर्ट
B. विश्व आर्थिक दृष्टिकोण कार्यक्रम
C. विश्व निवेश रिपोर्ट कार्यक्रम
D. उत्सर्जन अन्तर रिपोर्ट संयुक्त राष्ट्र सम्मेलन

## कूट :

A
B
C
D
(a) 3
1
4
2
(b) 3
4
1
2

4

Write in descending order the following States on the basis of their population as per Census, 2011:
Bihar
Andhra Pradesh
Uttar Pradesh

West Bengal

Choose the correct answer with the help of the following codes:
(a) $3,4,1,2$
(b) $1,3,2,4$
(c) $1,3,4,2$
(d) $3,1,4,2$

Match List-I with List-II and choose the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

List-I
A. Human Development Report
B. World Economic Outlook
C. World Investment Report
D. Emissions Gap Report

List-II
International Monetary Fund
United Nations Environment Programme
United Nations Development Programme

United Nations Conference on Trade and Development

Codes:

| A | B | C | D |  |
| :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- |
| (a) | 3 | 1 | 4 | 2 |
| (b) | 3 | 4 | 1 | 2 |
| (c) | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 |
| (d) | 2 | 3 | 4 | 1 |
Consider the following events and arrange them in correct chronological order starting from the earliest to the last activity:
Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana
Rural Employment Generation Programme
Prime Minister Rozgar Yojana

Valmiki Ambedkar Awas Yojana

Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) $2,3,4,1$
(b) $4,2,1,3$
(c) $1,2,3,4$
(d) $3,2,1,4$
The following lists I and II show the names of Economists/ Authors and their books respectively. Match List-1 with List-II and choose the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

विज्ञान में ईमानदारी विशेष रूप से महत्त्वपूर्ण है।

| List-I |  |  | List-II |
| :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- |
| (Economist/Author) | (Book) |  |  |
| A. Myrdal | 1. | Economic Theory and |  |
|  |  | Under-developed |  |
|  |  | Regions |  |
| B. Hirschman | 2. | The Strategy of |  |
|  |  | Economic Development |  |
| C. Kaldor | 3. | Strategic Factors in |  |
|  |  | Economic Development |  |
| D. Adam Smith | 4. | The Wealth of Nations |  |
| Codes: |  |  |  |
| A | B | C | D |
| (a) | 1 | 2 | 3 |
| (b) | 2 | 3 | 1 |
| (c) | 3 | 2 | 1 |
| (d) | 2 | 1 | 3 |

Which of the following statements is not true about "ecological niche"?
(a) Dominant species occupy extensive and broader ecological niche.
(b) Number of species becomes large in ecological niche of natural ecosystem, if resources are sufficient.
(c) Number of species becomes small in ecological niche, if resources are sufficient.
(d) Dominance of single species becomes minimum if the resource distribution is equitable in a habitat.

Match List-I with List-II and choose the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

| List-I |  |  | List-II |
| :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- |
| (Biosphere Reserve) | (State) |  |  |
| A. Simlipal | 1. | Kerala |  |
| B. Nokrek | 2. | Odisha |  |
| C. Agasthyamalai | 3. | Assam |  |
| D. Manas | 4. | Meghalaya |  |

Codes:

|  | A | B | C | D |
| :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- | :-- |
| (a) | 1 | 2 | 4 | 3 |
| (b) | 3 | 1 | 4 | 2 |
| (c) | 2 | 4 | 3 | 1 |
| (d) | 2 | 4 | 1 | 3 |
Consider the following statements:
Scientific investigation depends on commitment to practical ideals.
Honesty is particularly important in science.

इंडियन एसोसिएशन

नीचे दिए गए कूट में से सही उत्तर चुनिए:
(a) $1,2,4,3$
(b) $1,3,2,4$
(c) $2,1,4,3$
(d) $1,2,3,4$

Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) Both statements 1 and 2 are correct.
(b) Both statements 1 and 2 are incorrect.
(c) Statement 1 is correct, 2 is not correct.
(d) Statement 1 is correct, 2 is unpredictable.

Which of the following is the correct order of plant species from higher to lower order?
(a) Class - Phylum - Order - Plant Kingdom
(b) Order - Class - Phylum - Plant Kingdom
(c) Class - Plant Kingdom - Phylum - Order
(d) Plant Kingdom - Phylum - Class - Order
Consider the following statements with reference to the Justice Party:
The Justice Party opposed Congress by calling it a Brahmin dominated organisation.

It claimed the same communal representation for nonBrahmins as the Morley-Minto reforms had given to Muslims.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
(a) Both 1 and 2
(b) Neither I nor 2
(c) Only 1
(d) Only 2
Consider the following statements with reference to the Workers and Peasants Party:
The Workers and Peasants Party was formed in 1927 and was given the form of an All India Organisation.

The objective of this party was to work within the Congress so that it could be made a more revolution inclined party and an organisation of the common people.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
(a) Both 1 and 2
(b) Neither 1 nor 2
(c) Only 1
(d) Only 2
Consider the following events and arrange them in chronological order :
East India Association
National Indian Association
Indian Society

Indian Association

Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) $1,2,4,3$
(b) $1,3,2,4$
(c) $2,1,4,3$
(d) $1,2,3,4$

ब्रिटिश संसदीय प्रतिनिधिमंडल का दिल्ली में आगमन

नीचे दिए गए कूट में से सही उत्तर चुनिए :
(a) $4,3,2,1$
(b) $4,1,2,3$
(c) $4,2,1,3$
(d) $2,4,1,3$
Consider the following events and arrange them in correct chronological order starting from the earliest to the last activity:
Royal Indian Navy Revolt
Announcement of Cabinet Mission
Formation of Interim Government

Arrival of a UK Parliamentary Delegation in Delhi

Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) $4,3,2,1$
(b) $4,1,2,3$
(c) $4,2,1,3$
(d) $2,4,1,3$
With reference to the Age of Consent Act, 1891 consider the following statements:
It was Behramji Malabari, a Parsi reformer from Bombay, who advocated for this legislation.

The Act was supported by the extremist wing led by Bal Gangadhar Tilak.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
(a) Only 2
(b) Neither 1 nor 2
(c) Only 1
(d) Both 1 and 2

Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other as Reason (R).

Assertion (A): Shivaji had to face opposition from the big Deshmukhs.
Reason (R): These Deshmukhs were not in favour of an independent Maratha State and wanted to remain as feudal lords of Bijapur.
Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
(a) Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(b) (A) is false, but (R) is true.
(c) Both (A) and (R) are true, but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(d) (A) is true, but (R) is false.

Which of the following reasons caused catastrophic coral bleaching and mass coral deaths in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands?
(a) Increased industrial activities in the coastal regions
(b) Increase of $2^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$ temperature in the Indian Ocean
(c) Heavy marine pollution
(d) Decrease of temperature by $4^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$ in the Indian Ocean
